title: Morgana's spellshield now only blocks just one spell?

embed.description: Jax IMAGINE IF I HAD A REAL WEAPON Fixed a bug where Jax was causing games to crash under specific circumstances Janna When we updated Janna, we wanted to avoid hitting her too hard alongside the changes to Ardent Censer.

body:
I've just finished a game where I played Morgana, knowing the spellshields are now supposed to block only one spell, but ignoring it might have changed morg's e. And I noticed it just blocks one spell and it doesn't absorb any more damage from any other sources. So in my game there was a Sejuani going for my Tristana, I spellshielded her immediately and Sejuani engaged her with her Q,  then she did the rest of her spells on her. It did block sej's Q, but her other spells went through the shield, dealing the damage and cc to her instead of my shield. The rest of my shield was just hanging there, it clearly had at least 200 hp left and it was completely useless against every magic damage coming to Tristana.
After the game I went to read the exact description of Morgana's e and it says this :

**Places a protective barrier around an allied champion, absorbing magical damage and disables until penetrated or the shield dissipates.**

So the shield is supposed to work against any magic damage I said to myself, since it says it needs to be penetrated or needs to dissipates to not work anymore. It does not mention "Blocks damage from ONE source of damage or cc".

So I went to look at the patch (7.19) where the spellshield changes were in and it did not mention anything about  Morgana's e. It only mentionned this :

**AFFECTED STUFF Sivir’s E - Spell Shield, Nocturne’s W - Shroud of Darkness, Banshee’s Veil, Edge of Night**

I just need to know if this is a legit change or if it might be a bugg with the spellshield changes, because I really like playing Morgana and I felt like this change was really big in that game :/

Thanks in advance for the answers.

1. It prevents all disables from occurring while it's active. This is supposed to be unconditional.
2. It absorbs magic damage, breaking when the cap is reached.

If you're facing a physical-only lane, you don't ever need to rank up the shield because they'll never break it before the duration expires.

This is what I should have posted in the first place:

I suggest that you do a proper bug test. If you find that it works differently from what is stated on the tooltip and you can reproduce the bug consistently, submit a ticket about it.

As a former QA game tester, I can tell you that a single anecdote from one game is probably not going to get any potential bug looked into or fixed. The best way to get a developer to fix a bug:

1. Confirm with controlled testing without a doubt that the bug exists, and make sure you reference some kind of ingame tooltip or official literature that states it should work differently than what your test shows.

2. Detail the steps to reproduce the bug consistently and provide the percentage of attempts that these steps will cause the bug to occur (x/10 tries is sufficient)

3. Send a support ticket with all the relevant information. Even better if you can include video and/or screenshots.
